titles.title: Baby Steps (2015)
ベイビーステップ (2015)
网球优等生 第二季

anime.description: http://anidb.net/ch63156 [Maruo Eiichirou] has begun his training in America and quickly realizes that he has still a long way to go. Facing his comrades in the daily matches helps him to realize his own weaknesses and his time overseas proves to be extremely valuable for his development, both as a tennis player and as a person.

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: tennis
tag.description: Tennis is yet another sport involving hitting a ball. Were it not for the copious amounts of grass involved in certain varieties, it seems hard to imagine that people would pay it any attention at all.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: sports
tag.description: Sports anime revolves around a recreational physical activity or skill. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competition, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal.

tag.name: heart-warming
tag.description: The story and its characters give off good vibes — includes elevated feelings of affection such as tenderness, sympathy and love, all in one package. The kind of anime which leaves you with a warm feeling inside and you can not stop smiling while watching it.

tag.name: slide show animation
tag.description: The entire anime or parts of it show sequences of still images. Sometimes used in low budged animations for action scenes.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

episode.title: シンプルで覚醒
Awakening to Simplicity
Stimuler par la simplicité
Simple de Kakusei
episode.summary: Eiichiro versus Alex. Alex feels threatened by Eiichiro`s note-taking during the match. However, Alex calmly responds to Eiichiro`s method and fights back by changing his play style. Unable to use the data he collected, Eiichiro`s decides to concentrate on reacting to Alex rather than thinking about strategy. Eiichiro`s movements improved the moment he realized he can trust his body to move instinctively. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 未来のデータ
Data for the Future
Les données du futur
Mirai no Data
episode.summary: Oda Eiichiro finally recovers from his losing streak and is able to play a match against Ike Soji. Eiichiro approaches the match having more confidence than before but he is defeated immediately in a very one-sided match against Ike. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 悪循環がラッキー
A Vicious Circle Is Lucky
L`avantage du cercle vicieux
Akujunkan ga Lucky
episode.summary: During Eiichiro’s first day of practice, Alex, a professional player, refuses to have a match with him. However, another professional player, Ike Souji, declares that he will play a match against anyone who can beat Eiichiro. Thanks to this, Alex and many other players end up playing against Eiichiro. While dealing with the weight of ball, Eiichiro uses his special control skill but is still unable to win. Eiichiro is troubled when… Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 世界と壁
The World and the Wall
Le monde et le mur
Sekai to Kabe
episode.summary: With the aim of becoming a professional tennis player, Eiichiro trains abroad at the Florida Tennis Academy for a short while. Being within an environment solely dedicated to tennis excites Eiichiro. When all of the sudden, he meets Marcia, a girl with a beautiful smile. The two have a match with each other as told by the coach. Marcia’s hits were stronger than expected, but she increasingly became irritated… Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: タクマの決意
Takuma`s Decision
La décision de Takuma
Takuma no Ketsui
episode.summary: After returning from his Florida Exchange Program, Eiichiro reunites with Natsu and Yukichi at STC (Southern Tennis Club). But their reunion celebration is cut short due to the strict training for the Kanagawa Prefectural Junior Tennis Championship. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 偵察で初遭遇
First Encounter by Scouting
Première rencontre en observation
Teisatsu de Hatsu Souguu
episode.summary: Eiichiro and Aoi coach train specifically to strengthen Eiichiro`s serve after learning the importance of it from his match against Takuma. The third term of school begins as Eiichiro remembers his promise to give up on becoming a professional tennis player if he doesn`t win the All-Japan Junior Tournament. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 正念場のリベンジ
Revenge at the Critical Moment
Une revanche au sommet
Shounenba no Revenge
episode.summary: The Kanagawa Junior Tournament has just begun; this event will determine Eiichiro`s entire future. The first round is against Nishimura who happens to be an underclassmen of Araya, Eiichiro`s rival. Araya tells Eiichiro that he told Nishimura all about his weaknesses as the match begins. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 進化のスピード
The Speed of Evolution
Vitesse de progression
Shinka no Speed
episode.summary: Eiichiro’s second match is with Miyagawa whose future will also be determined by this tournament. In order to improve from his past self, he acquired a new “weapon” and puts it to the test. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 感覚で困惑
Baffled by Intuition
Confusion par la sensation
Kankaku de Konwaku
episode.summary: Due to Coach Sakakibara`s suggestion, Eiichiro and Natsu play a practice match against each other. Eiichiro is hesitant but Coach Aoi explains that he wants Eiichiro to absorb Natsu`s instinctive style of tennis by playing against her. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 雄たけびでスタート
Start with a Roar
Démarrage sur un cri de guerre
Otakebi de Start
episode.summary: Araya and Eiichiro face each other for the second time. Araya uses his overwhelming strength and speed to go for the break while Eiichiro uses his control to aim for the break. Not only has Araya`s strength and speed increase from last year but his psychological weak points have also been fixed. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 選択肢と爆発力
Choices and Explosive Power
Choix et explosivité
Sentakushi to Bakuhatsuryoku
episode.summary: Eiichiro realizes why he`s been struggling until now; it is due to Araya`s left-handedness. With his incredible ability to analyze, Eiichiro discovers strategic ways to handle Araya`s left-handed play and gradually learns to return shots. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 逆境に全力
Full Force Toward Adversity
À fond dans l`adversité
Gyakkyou ni Zenryoku
episode.summary: As their intense match continues, Eiichiro and Araya reach the final set, which will ultimately determine the winner. Araya attacks with even more heightened speed and power, and Eiichiro responds by using his control to attack. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ライバルが集結
Gathering of Rivals
Addiction
Rival ga Shuuketsu
episode.summary: As the match finally ends and Eiichiro is reminded how much he truly enjoys tennis, he asks himself if he`ll truly be able to give up if he should lose at the All-Japan Junior. Meanwhile, it`s decided that the STC will participate in joint practices with other tennis clubs... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: スパッでギューン
Whish, Then Fwoom
Spam ! Et Gwiiip
Spa de Gyuun
episode.summary: Eiichiro is stunned by all the cheering Ide receives as their match begins. He struggles with the unpredictable plays of the intuitive Ide, but he recalls what he learned in his match with Natsu and concentrates on watching his opponent. Meanwhile, Ide also struggles to keep up with Eiichiro`s constant changes in tempo and starts to tune out the world as he tries to focus. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ヒーローと大歓声
A Hero and Loud Cheers
Héros et grandes acclamations
Hero to Daikansei
episode.summary: The Kanto Junior Tennis Tournament begins at last, and Eiichiro is facing Yakabe Tadanori in his first match. Although he had watched videos of Yakabe`s matches from a year ago, Eiichiro is bewildered by his opponent`s much taller stature and completely different play style, and all the unexpected factors lead him to consider blanking all his mental data and starting from scratch. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 月明かりと波音
Moonlight and the Sound of Waves
Clair de lune et bruit de vagues
Tsukiakari to Namioto
episode.summary: The final door on the way to the All-Japan Junior, the Kanto Junior Tournament, is just around the corner. Eiichiro psyches himself up as he confirms his promise to his parents that he`ll give up if he doesn`t win the All-Japan Junior, and then he sets off with the other STC members for Chiba, where the Kanto Junior will be held. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 天性でドラマチック
Dramatic by Nature
Dramatique de nature
Tensei to Dramatic
episode.summary: Ide`s remarkable ability to adapt instantly to everything has Eiichiro struggling, and reads his notes again to regain his focus. This improves his movements and leads to more impressive rallies, making the match even more exciting. Neither is willing to yield as the match comes down to which player can manage to hold serve... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 失礼が初対面
A Rude First Meeting
Première rencontre impolie
Shitsurei ga Shotaimen
episode.summary: Eitaro, upon winning spectacularly in his fight against Ide, decides to go to the National Junior`s. Coach Aoi explains that towards the end of the match, Eitaro was completely in the zone. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: プレッシャーをイメージ
Visualize the Pressure
visualiser la pression
Pressure o Image
episode.summary: Eiichiro thought he was successfully ignoring the crowd`s roaring cheers for Ide, but his body was reacting to it more than he realized. The pressure of playing in front of a dramatic, Ide-centric crowd is troubling Eiichiro. What can he do to overcome this situation? Eiichiro wrote down the pressure he felt in his notebook and tries to face the details he has been ignoring. Ide is on his game as his crowd cheers on; what will lead to Eiichiro`s road to victory?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 善悪と規則
Good, Evil, and Rules
Le bien, le mal et les règles
Zen`aku to Kisoku
episode.summary: Even if it seems to lack etiquette, Takagi`s play style continues to work in his favor by disupting his opponent`s pace. Eiichiro struggles to deal with Takagi`s tactics. He tries to use his anger to his advantage, but he isn`t successful. Eiichiro tries to remain calm and rational but this leads to a time-warning issued by the referee... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 心理戦と自制心
Psychological Warfare and Self-Control
Combat psychologique et maîtrise de soi
Shinrisen to Jiseishin
episode.summary: The match against Takagi begins. Just as Yukichi warned, Takagi`s style is unique. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 存在が原動力
Existence Is the Driving Force
La présence comme moteur
Sonzai ga Gendouryoku
episode.summary: After beating Takagi, Eiichiro moves onto the semi-finals as does Natsu in the women`s division. Eiichiro becomes aware of new feelings towards Natsu while watching her match. The next match is against the top tennis player, Nabae who has no physical or psychological weaknesses. While Eiichiro is troubled by what strategy to use, Takuma reveals Nabae`s childhood weakness to Eiichiro. The battle against Nabae, the greatest opponent is about to begin! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 積極的で理想的
Aggressive Is Ideal
Volontaire et idéal
Sekkyokuteki de Risouteki
episode.summary: The match has just begun and Eiichiro is already close to being in the zone. His excellent condition is reminiscent of his match against Ide; Eiichiro doesn`t give Nabae a chance to fight back and soon takes the lead. Nabae is surprised at Eiichiro`s aggressive play but remains calm and collects data by carefully analyzing Eiichiro`s moves and attack patterns. However, Eiichiro`s momentum is relentless. It seemed like he would take the first set when... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 無謀と意外性
Recklessness and Surprise
Imprudence et inattendu
Mubou to Igaisei
episode.summary: Nabae returns Eiichirou`s best flat serve easily. Thinking he can`t beat Nabae like this, Eiichirou decides to take the risk of playing a pushy game. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ファイナルセット
Final Set
Dernier set
Final Set
episode.summary: The match between Eiichirou and Nabae finally reaches its thrilling climax, and the former risks losing to envision his victory. Source: crunchyroll
